discussion.content: Server hardening means securing server from cyber attacks. if the new components such as motherboard, ram or processors added to the server so its the first rule to have updated drivers for all the new components installed in the server. But to follow the company's procedure to secure server, the i think security patch/updates is the necessary step to do in this question. so in my view OS updates is the answer

Selected Answer: B
Components = hardware. Hardware = drivers.

Selected Answer: C
C. OS security updates

In this scenario, the mission-critical server has had new components added to it, which may introduce potential security vulnerabilities. To ensure the server remains secure and compliant with corporate policies, it's crucial to apply OS security updates. These updates include patches, fixes, and security enhancements provided by the operating system vendor to address known vulnerabilities and strengthen the overall security posture of the system. Hardening requirements typically involve keeping the system up to date with the latest security patches to mitigate the risk of exploitation by malicious actors. While definition, driver, and application updates are also important for maintaining system integrity and functionality, OS security updates are paramount for addressing security vulnerabilities and maintaining server hardening standards.

comments.content: No. Adding components will not magically make new OS security updates appear. What you need though, is drivers that are up-to-date so that potential old security holes are patched. The answer is B

questions.question_text: Several new components have been added to a mission-critical server, and corporate policy states all new components must meet server hardening requirements. Which of the following should be applied?

choices.A: Schedule a mandatory reboot of the server
choices.B: Wait for the load average to come back down on its own
choices.D: Request that users log off the server
choices.C: Identify the runaway process or processes

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
the answer is C for sure

Selected Answer: C
Well, you don't want to reboot unless it's absolutely necessary. So no. And why would I boot users who have nothing to do with the problem? Find the problem process, and maybe the associated user, and address it from there.

comments.content:
(cont.)
How can I identify a runaway process on my computer?
The 'w' command at the terminal will print out a list of current users of a machine, and it will tell you the machine's “load average.” The load average of a machine is related to how much input/output the machine has to do. A load average of 1 is a machine under full load. Anything over 1 is extremely high and means that the machine is getting behind on its processing. If your machine has a load average near or over 1, and you are not running anything really resource intensive on the machine, then you probably have a runaway process sapping your machine's processing power.

https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/load-average-in-linux
https://docs.cs.byu.edu/doku.php?id=runaway-processes

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Load Average in Linux is a metric that is used by Linux users to keep track of system resources. It also helps you monitor how the system resources are engaged.
To understand the Load Average in Linux, we need to know what do we define as load. In a Linux system, the load is a measure of CPU utilization at any given moment.
It refers to the number of processes which are either currently being executed by the CPU or are waiting for execution.
An idle system has a load of 0. With each process that is being executed or is on the waitlist, the load increases by 1.

Occasionally a process will stop responding to the system and run wild. These processes ignore their scheduling priority and insist on taking up 100% of the CPU. Because other processes can only get limited access to the CPU, the machine begins to run very slowly.

https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/load-average-in-linux
https://docs.cs.byu.edu/doku.php?id=runaway-processes
Users logging off does not seem to be the answer here. I would identify the processes and possibly reboot the server depending on what I find going wrong with the TOP command.

questions.question_text:
A technician runs top on a dual-core server and notes the following conditions: top `"- 14:32:27, 364 days, 14 users load average 60.5 12.4 13.6
Which of the following actions should the administrator take?

choices.D: The core switch has a network issue.
choices.C: The application should be changed to use port 443.
choices.A: Intrusion detection is blocking the port.
choices.B: The new application's DNS entry is incorrect.

questions.question_text: A server administrator deployed a new product that uses a non-standard port for web access on port 8443. However, users are unable to access the new application. The server administrator checks firewall rules and determines 8443 is allowed. Which of the following is most likely the cause of the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
This is most likely a DNS configuration of the new server that was deployed.

comments.content: Another user here who should refrain voting, completely messing up the answers.
bro all you use is ChatGPT and don't use any personal reasoning. IDS = Intrusion DETECTION System NOT a PREVENTIVE system.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Intrusion detection is blocking the port.

Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS) or Intrusion Prevention Systems (IPS) often monitor network traffic for suspicious activities and can block access to ports based on security policies or detected anomalies. If the IDS/IPS was not configured to recognize traffic on port 8443 as legitimate, it might automatically block access to this port, even if the firewall rules allow it.

questions.question_text:
SIMULATION
-

Users report that the FinanceApp software is not running, and they need immediate access. Issues with the FinanceApp software occur every week after the IT team completes server system updates. The users, however, do not want to contact the help desk every time the issue occurs.

The users also report the new MarketApp software is not usable when it crashes, which can cause significant downtime. The technician who restarted the MarketApp software noticed it is running under a test account, which is a likely cause of the crashes.


INSTRUCTIONS
-

Using the Services menu provided, modify the appropriate application services to remedy the stated issues.

If at any time you would like to bring back the initial state of the simulation, please click the Reset All button.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
FinanceApp Service:

- Set the FinanceApp Service to automatically restart if it stops. This ensures the service is always running after system updates.

- Change the startup type to Automatic if it is not already set. This ensures the service starts automatically after a reboot.

MarketApp Service:

- Change the MarketApp Service to run under a more appropriate account instead of a test account. Typically, this should be a service account with the necessary permissions.

- Set the startup type to Automatic to ensure it starts automatically and reduces downtime.

it doesnt matter if the server is located at papermill or any building. it is asking what should the tech do FIRST? The first thing is to check power cables because server being randomly rebooting causes some hardware failures(including fans) but what should you do as a technician first?
well as a tech, i ll look for event logs or some link lights but since the options are limited here so the best answer among all is A

Selected Answer: B
Because a paper mill is a very dusty environment, even the "clean" areas (offices, IT spaces, etc) are going to be "dirty." Cleaning the fans is probably the best place to start. It's really kind of a toss-up, since it could be a faulty power cable arcing after it warms up enough due to current flow, or it could be the server shutting off after it gets too hot because the fans are caked in debris. Not a great question, and an excellent example of why I dislike CompTIA questions.

Selected Answer: B
Obviously B overheating

Selected Answer: A
A is simplest and most likely solution

questions.question_text: A server located in an IDF of a paper mill reboots every other day at random times. Which of the following should the technician perform on the server first?
